instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
IMac a1418 820-00431 no power 
1 led diagnostic lights

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Schematic and boardview here:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YwbI5L7bD9K2w0LzdrDuu88PHcukPXka/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).
Use J5120 pads, instead of power button.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: buongiorno scusa ma sono un pò alle prime armi su alcune misure potresti spiegarmi come posso fare la misura che mi hai indicato?

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: good morning sorry but I'm a little beginner on some measurements could you explain to me how I can do the measurement you indicated?

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
Read this thread first:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
Find any test point, or component connected to PM_PWRBTN_L, to check the pulse.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
ok correct me if I'm wrong I connect with a wire j5120 pin 1-pin2,
and then I measure PM_PWRBTN_L on r1885?

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: As in the thread explained, just temporar contact; similar as pressing power button...

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: I have tested with your info and i found on datasheet the two pin. I have put just temporar contact and after tested the R1885 voltage 3,45  PM_PWRBTN_L

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: You must check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L [U]at same time[/U] when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
When the button is pressed, there is no pulse on the PM_PWRBTN_L
 voltage remains constant at 3.5v

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
This points to SMC issue.

Do you get 12MHz at Y5165?
If no o-scope available, post DC voltage on its pins.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
press smc on-off  
PM_PWRBTN_L 3,45v -0,12 v

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: Check if PM_SLP_S4_L pulses at same time.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
press smc on-off
PM_SLP_S4_L  3,31v - 0,00v

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
When press the power button, PM_SLP_S4_L should go high, from 0V to 3V; not viceversa.
Do you get high PM_SLP_S4_L when the power is applied, before pressing power button?

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: yes before press smc on/ off

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
That's good, means the power on sequence starts when the power is connected.
Do you get S3 voltages too, when PM_SLP_S4_L is high?

Also check PM_SLP_S3_L and S0 voltages.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: ok ok could you tell me specifically which voltage to check S0?

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message:
Page 68 shows you the S0 enables signals.
Just follow each of them and check the corresponding power rails.

First confirm PM_SLP_S3_L presence, of course.

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: PM_SLP_S3_L 3,31v

threads.title: 820-00431-a no power IMac a1418
threads.message: Then do what I said; locate the S0 voltages, as above indicated.
